Patent Information.Patent Title: Selectively targeted antimicrobial peptides and the use thereof.
Patent Information.Abstract: The present invention relates to targeting peptides capable of specifically binding to microbial organisms (e.g., P. aeruginosa or S. mutans), antimicrobial peptides having antimicrobial activities, and specifically/selectively targeted antimicrobial peptides (STAMPs). In addition, the present invention provides methods of selectively killing or inhibiting microbial organisms by using the peptides or compositions provided by the present invention.

Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Dermaseptin-5 (DS V; Dermaseptin-S5, DS5; Frogs, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the frog skin active peptide family (Dermaseptin subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Swiss_Prot Entry P80281]Possesses a potent antimicrobial activity against bacteria, fungi and protozoa
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref:8306981]Show strong hemolytic activity against rabbit healthy erythrocytes
Sequence Information.Mechanism of action: Probably acts by disturbing membrane functions with its amphipathic structure. Binds to healthy erythrocytes (this binding is receptor independent), and has strong hemolytic activity. Does not bind to P.falciparum infected erythrocytes, but accumulates within the parasite.
Sequence Information.Medical use: Derivatives of this peptide may be used as therapeutic agents to treat bacterial infections and malaria, and to prevent infection by herpes simplex virus type 1 and HIV-1.

Literature.Title: Isolation and structure of novel defensive peptides from frog skin.
Literature.Author: Mor A, Nicolas P.
